description: Luffy stretches both arms backward and then thrusts them forward in a spear-like motion at high speed using Gear Second. The attack is powerful enough to break through solid barriers and floors.

keyMoments.context: Luffy uses this technique to break free from Monet's freezing embrace
keyMoments.outcome: Successfully breaks through the floor, though inadvertently causes Luffy to fall into the garbage disposal

description: Monet creates ten layers of solid snow hut barriers around her opponent. As a Logia user, she can pass through the snow freely while her opponents are trapped. The technique is designed to trap and delay opponents.

keyMoments.context: Monet uses this technique to trap Luffy and set up her freezing embrace attack
keyMoments.outcome: Successfully traps Luffy temporarily, allowing Monet to execute her strategy

description: Law grabs his opponent and sends a large electrical surge through their body, similar to a defibrillator. The technique can cause significant damage and paralysis.

keyMoments.context: Law uses this as a desperate counter-attack while being tortured by Vergo
keyMoments.outcome: The attack does minimal damage due to Vergo's superior Haki defense

description: Vergo hardens his entire body or large portions of it with Busoshoku Haki, creating an incredibly strong offense and defense. This level of Haki mastery was rare at this point in the series.

keyMoments.context: Vergo demonstrates his Haki prowess while brutally attacking Law
keyMoments.outcome: Overwhelms Law's defenses and establishes Vergo as a formidable Haki user

description: Vergo imbues his bamboo stick with Busoshoku Haki, hardening it to deliver devastating strikes. The Haki-enhanced bamboo is strong enough to shatter weapons and create powerful shockwaves.

keyMoments.context: Vergo uses his Haki-imbued bamboo to attack Law during their confrontation
